subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: I don t think the performance overhead associated with reflection is as much of an issue as it was in early versions of Java, but the loss of static typing
messageBody:
I don't think the performance overhead associated with reflection is as
much of an issue as it was in early versions of Java, but the loss of
static typing always puts me off using the reflection API.
--
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 2/1/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>>
>> What's up with that? Why do so many people find reflection so dangerous?
>>
>
> - Loss of static typing
> - Can break when refactoring
> - Performance overhead
>
> --
> Cédric
